intro: Eschscholzia thermophila, commonly known as the hotland poppy, is a flowering plant native to the hot, arid regions of California. It is characterized by its vibrant orange or red petals and is adapted to thrive in high-temperature environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species. Due to its specialized habitat, Eschscholzia thermophila is considered a rare and sensitive species.
